result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerry W. Hughes II
Current: 7525 Franklin Street, Iron River, WI 54847 United States  (Effective: 03-02-2022)
Prior: 1113 4th Avenue S, Rm 115, Park Falls, WI 54552

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): D. D. R. unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office or the Price County Sheriff's Department outside of normal business hours. 
  No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:20 AM Defendant Jerry W. Hughes appeared in court via telephone. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Notice of right to attorney given to DE.   DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all count.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
